page_analysis.text_content:
Daylight
plane

The daylight plane in
conjunction with the
setbacks & height
limits, create an
invisible tent

intended to contain
development on the lot
in a way that preserves
privacy and exposure to
natural light.

Code sections
Page 26
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
Page 27
18.04
Page 28
18.12.040 (c) Table 2
Page 29
18.12.050 (b) (2)
18.12.040 (j)
26
Primary daylight plane (sides)

The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area.
Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-
structure daylight plan described on the next page.

Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane

Side lot line
10′ from
average
grade

Max. allowed is
Min. required by
Building Code

45°

Average grade

Grade at the nearest point
on the adjacent lot

Existing grade of the structure
(at midpoint of wall)

Notes:
• Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
• Average grade is established using existing
grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)
• Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
• Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

Side lot line

24' max. for protrusions
*
Max. building height

visual_elements.description: A 3D wireframe diagram of a simple house-like structure, representing an 'invisible tent' formed by daylight plane, setbacks, and height limits.

Figure 20: Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane. The diagram illustrates two houses on a sloped lot, with a 'Side lot line' indicated. A dashed line representing the daylight plane originates 10' above the average grade at the side lot line and slopes upwards at 45 degrees over the house on the right. The diagram also shows 'Max. allowed is Min. required by Building Code' for a chimney-like protrusion, '24' max. for protrusions' from the side lot line, and 'Max. building height' indicated by an asterisk. The 'Average grade', 'Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot', and 'Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall)' are also marked.

technical_specifications.parameter: Daylight plane origin height from average grade

qualifiers.text: in the rear and/or side yards

conditions.text: The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area.
Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.
Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)
Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.
Max. allowed is Min. required by Building Code

execution_sequence.action: Identify structures located within the buildable area.
Apply primary daylight plane regulations to structures identified in Step 1.
Identify structures located in rear and/or side yards.
Regulate structures identified in Step 3 by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.
Measure daylight plane from average grade.
Establish average grade using existing grade before any grading or fill, referencing Fig 44 p. 42.
Measure side daylight plane at lot line.
Measure rear daylight plane at rear setback.
Ensure maximum allowed height for protrusions does not exceed 24 feet.
Ensure the daylight plane originates 10 feet from average grade.
Ensure the daylight plane slopes at 45 degrees.
Comply with Building Code for minimum required and maximum allowed dimensions.
